result.execSummary:
The defendant Marie S Wagner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Entry into Locked Coin Box [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.125(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Civil Judgment for Restitution, surcharges and costs.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs to be paid as a Condition of Probation. DNA surcharge is WAIVED.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain/obtain full time employment and/or school.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
No contact with Stacy K., or Evergreen Fuel.

Restitution to be paid joint and severally as a Condition of Probation.
Restitution hearing scheduled for 7/09/2015 by 11AM.

timeConds.notes: To be performed in one year as a Condition of Probation.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Nicole M Masnica in court.   Defendant Marie S Wagner did not appear at 11:08 a.m..   Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin. This case is not being contested. Defendant is liable for restitution. Restitution is already reflected on the Judgment of Conviction. No amended ordered is needed.
Restitution hearing on July 9, 2015 at 11:00 am.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Marie S Wagner in court with attorney Nicole M Masnica.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty. Defense requests a restitution hearing. Court grants request. 


Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- 7 months jail straight time STAYED for 1 year Probation
- Court Costs of $243.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- Restitution of $464.00 - joint and severally - to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
- DNA Surcharge waived.
- Conditions of  Probation: AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling. Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s..   Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No drug paraphernalia. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; Inform Agent of all prescriptions. Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling or any other approved activity by agent. No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed. No contact with Stacy K. or Evergreen Fuel.   
 - Defendant to perform 50 hours of community service in one year as a condition of Probation.
  Restitution hearing scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

with attached witness list filed by the State.
